intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. euchloodes, commonly known as the two-lobed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped with distinct lobes, and the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is noted for its ornamental value and is often found in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
